description: Numbers n such that for any i > 0 there is some j > 0 such that the prime(i)-adic valuation of n, say x, equals the prime(j)-adic valuation of n and x = abs(i-j) (where prime(k) denotes the k-th prime number and the p-adic valuation of a number is the greatest m such that p^m divides that number).
